feature.name: adapter_use_stub
feature.doc: If enabled, use the adapter logical stub interface.

feature.name: macro_A_half_nof_clusters_enable
feature.doc: If enabled, macro A only supports half the nof_macro_clusters.

feature.name: macro_A_75_nof_clusters_enable
feature.doc: If enabled, macro A (1,2,3,4,7,8,9,11) only supports half the nof_macro_clusters.

feature.name: bpu_setup_extended_support
feature.doc: If enabled, supports extended bpu setup options such as 120_240_120 and 120_360.

define.name: nof_macroes_type_A
define.doc: The NOF type A macroes in the device

define.name: nof_macroes_type_B
define.doc: The NOF type B macroes in the device

define.name: total_nof_macroes
define.doc: the total NOF macroes in the device

define.name: total_nof_macroes_plus_em_ovf_or_eedb_bank
define.doc: the total NOF macroes in the device plus another place for either the OVF buffer for EM tables or banks for EEDB tables.

define.name: total_nof_macroes_plus_data_width
define.doc: he total NOF macroes in the device plus another place for the data width.

define.name: max_nof_cluster_interfaces
define.doc: max NOF interfaces that can be associated with a single cluster.

define.name: nof_macro_clusters
define.doc: nof clusters in a single macro.

define.name: nof_bucket_clusters
define.doc: nof clusters in a a bucket

define.name: nof_buckets_in_macro
define.doc: The NOF buckets in a macro

define.name: nof_pair_clusters
define.doc: nof clusters in a pair.

define.name: nof_bits_address_in_macro_a_cluster
define.doc: NOF bits needed for a cluster A address.

define.name: nof_bits_address_in_macro_b_cluster
define.doc: NOF bits needed for a cluster B address.

define.name: nof_rows_in_macro_a_cluster
define.doc: NOF rows in a cluster that is places on a macro of type A.

define.name: nof_rows_in_macro_b_cluster
define.doc: NOF rows in a cluster that is places on a macro of type B.

define.name: nof_rows_in_eedb_bank
define.doc: NOF rows in an EEDB bank

define.name: nof_data_rows_per_hitbit_row
define.doc: How many eedb rows each hitbit row is mapped to

define.name: nof_rows_in_eedb_hitbit_bank
define.doc: How many rows in each eedb hitbit bank

define.name: cluster_row_width_bits
define.doc: NOF bits in a single cluster row.

define.name: has_dhc_type_blocks
define.doc: This device uses DHC types blocks

define.name: data_out_granularity
define.doc: The granularity used for data out.

define.name: bpu_setup_bb_connected
define.doc: If set, the two buckets are connected, also known as J2 960 mode.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_120_240_120
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 120_240_120 bucket allocation, requires extended.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_480_odd
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 480_odd bucket allocation, the odd is used to distinguish between buckets in case of 960 allocation.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_480
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 480 bucket allocation.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_360_120
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 360_120 bucket allocation, requires extended.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_120_360
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 120_360 bucket allocation, requires extended.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_240_240
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 240_240 bucket allocation.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_120_120_240
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 120_120_240 bucket allocation.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_240_120_120
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 240_120_120 bucket allocation.

define.name: bpu_setup_size_120_120_120_120
define.doc: The BPU setup size associated with 120_120_120_120 bucket allocation.

define.name: ddha_dynamic_memory_access_dpc
define.doc: The DDHA dynamic memory is of DPC type.

table.name: dh_info
table.doc: general information of the MDB data handlers

value.name: table_macro_interface_mapping
value.doc: This is a mapping from a PDB MAG to the available DHs that connected to it.Each row represent a MAG and each column the MACROs A0, A1, A2 .... A11, B0, B1 ... B7.The last column in every row is the position after the last available DH which used for the OVF (relevant for EM only).0xF means that the MAG isn't connected to the MACRO otherwise the number represent the serialconnection number of the MACRO to the MAGThere are some DHs which have 2 interfaces to the same MAG, in that case the difference between two legal interface values will be 2.

value.name: cluster_if_offsets_values
value.doc: The following array maps a PDB into his data in offset position (byte granularity) in a macro.Each column represent a macro A0, A1 ... A11, B0, .. B7 and the last column is the PDB data size (byte granularity).

value.name: if_cluster_offsets_values
value.doc: This table holds the position of all the 30 bits chunks of a PDB in the IF cluster offset register.Each column represent a macro A0, A1 ... A11, B0, .. B7 and the last column is the PDB data size (30 bits granularity).

value.name: row_width
value.doc: The table row width in bits.

value.name: two_ways_connectivity_bm
value.doc: Bit map of all the DHs that have two ways for a given PDB.

table.name: macro_interface_mapping
table.doc: The available interfaces for each macro

key.name: global_macro_index
key.doc: global macro index including all the macro types in the count.

table.name: table_way_to_macro_mapping
table.doc: Maps from table way to global macro index, this is the reverse mapping of dh_info->table_macro_interface_mapping

value.name: table_way_to_macro_mapping
value.doc: This is a mapping from a table way to global macro index, assumes no table is connected to more than NOF_MACROES_TYPE_A macros. Default value is NOF_MACRO_A + NOF_MACRO_B

key.name: global_macro_index
key.doc: global macro index including all the macro types in the count.

value.name: block_type
value.doc: the block type that used by the DH macro (e.g. DDHA, DDHB or DHC)

value.name: block_index
value.doc: each block type have several blocks, this is the instance of the block type used by this DH

value.name: macro_halved
value.doc: TRUE/FALSE if the macro is halved

table.name: entry_banks_info
table.doc: holds the DHs entry banks and ABK banks information.

key.name: global_macro_index
key.doc: global macro index including all the macro types in the count.

value.name: overflow_reg
value.doc: The overflow buffer used to hold the overflowed data of the last entry in the bank.

value.name: abk_bank_a
value.doc: The ABK memory of type A (destination hit bit)

value.name: abk_bank_b
value.doc: The ABK memory of type B ()source hit bit)

define.name: max_nof_interface_dhs
define.doc: Max nof different DHs that can be associated with a single interface

define.name: kaps_nof_blocks
define.doc: NOF KPAS blocks

define.name: mesh_mode_support
define.doc: Indicate if the device support mesh mode.

define.name: max_key_size
define.doc: The largest key size from all the PDBs key sizes.

define.name: max_payload_size
define.doc: The largest payload size from all the PDBs payloads sizes.

define.name: table_mdb_9_mdb_item_1_array_size
define.doc: no description.

define.name: table_mdb_9_mdb_item_2_array_size
define.doc: no description.

define.name: table_mdb_9_mdb_item_3_array_size
define.doc: no description.

define.name: table_mdb_40_mdb_item_0_array_size
define.doc: no description.

define.name: table_mdb_dynamic_memory_access_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The MDB dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_mact_dynamic_memory_access_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The MACT dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_kaps_dynamic_memory_access_sbc_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The KAPS SBC dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_kaps_dynamic_memory_access_dpc_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The KAPS DPC dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_ddha_dynamic_memory_access_sbc_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The DDHA SBC dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_ddha_dynamic_memory_access_dpc_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The DDHA DPC dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: table_mdb_ddhb_dynamic_memory_access_memory_access_field_size
define.doc: The DDHB dynamic memory access register size.

define.name: mdb_nof_profiles
define.doc: The global number of supported MDB profiles.

key.name: mdb_profile_index
key.doc: The MDB profile index, iterated on using mdb_nof_profiles.

value.name: supported
value.doc: TRUE/FALSE valid indication per profile. Different devices/SKUs support different profiles.

value.name: name
value.doc: The profile name, compared with the mdb_profile soc property.

table.name: mdb_profile_kaps_cfg
table.doc: KAPS database configuration based on the MDB profile

table.name: pdbs_info
table.doc: general information of the MDB physical data bases

value.name: db_type
value.doc: the DB type EM, direct, KAPS, TCAM or EEDB

value.name: row_width
value.doc: The table row width in bits.

value.name: direct_max_payload_type
value.doc: the direct max payload size. Different from payload size for INLIF (60 vs. 120/180)

table.name: pdb_info
table.doc: general information of the MDB physical data bases

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB

value.name: logical_to_physical
value.doc: map between MDB logical DB into a physical DB.

value.name: db_type
value.doc: the DB type EM, direct, KAPS, TCAM or EEDB

value.name: row_width
value.doc: The table row width in bits.

value.name: max_key_size
value.doc: The maximal key size used for this PDB.

value.name: max_payload_size
value.doc: The maximal payload size used from this PDB.

table.name: mdb_adapter_mapping
table.doc: Mapping between DBAL MDB physical tables and adapter memory IDs.

feature.name: entry_type_parser
feature.doc: Is the entry type parsed by HW (or needs to be provided)?

define.name: total_nof_lem_aging_bits
define.doc: The total number of bits available for the LEM aging.

define.name: total_nof_exem_aging_bits
define.doc: The total number of bits available for the EXEM aging.

define.name: age_row_size_bits
define.doc: The number of bits in a single aging memory row

define.name: age_ovfcam_row_size_bits
define.doc: The number of bits in a single aging ovfcam memory row

define.name: age_entry_size_bits
define.doc: The number of bits in a single aging memory entry

define.name: ovf_cam_max_size
define.doc: the MAX size of an OVF CAM.

define.name: age_support_per_entry_size_ratio
define.doc: Indicate if the aging profiles are supported per entry ratio size.

define.name: nof_aging_profiles
define.doc: The NOF aging profile avialable in the device.

define.name: aging_profiles_size_in_bits
define.doc: The number of bits needed for the NOF aging profiles.

define.name: max_tid_size
define.doc: The largest TID size in bits.

define.name: max_nof_tids
define.doc: max NOF of TIDs for a PDB

define.name: flush_support_tids
define.doc: The max NOF of TIDs an MDB table that support flush machine could have.

define.name: flush_max_supported_key
define.doc: The largest key size that can be used by the flush machine.

define.name: flush_max_supported_payload
define.doc: The largest payload size that can be used by the flush machine.

define.name: flush_max_supported_key_plus_payload
define.doc: The largest key+payload size that can be used by the flush machine.

define.name: dh_120_entry_encoding_nof_bits
define.doc: Number of bits representing a EM DH 120 width cluster encoding value.

define.name: dh_240_entry_encoding_nof_bits
define.doc: Number of bits representing a EM DH 240 width cluster encoding value.

define.name: format_granularity
define.doc: The granularity used for the EM format configuration.

define.name: max_nof_vmv_size
define.doc: The number of bits used to represent the vmv, smaller vmv sizes are simply aligned to the MSB and the configuration iterates on all possible values of the LSB.

define.name: vmv_nof_values
define.doc: NOF values available for the VMV (depends on the nof_vmv_size value)

define.name: nof_vmv_size_nof_bits
define.doc: the nof_vmv_size size in bits.

define.name: esem_nof_vmv_size
define.doc: The number of bits used to represent the vmv for ESEM only, smaller vmv sizes are simply aligned to the MSB and the configuration iterates on all possible values of the LSB.

define.name: glem_nof_vmv_size
define.doc: The number of bits used to represent the VMV for GLEM only, smaller vmv sizes are simply aligned to the MDB and the configuration iterates on all possible values of the LSB.

define.name: mact_nof_vmv_size
define.doc: The number of bits used to represent the vmv for MACT only, smaller vmv sizes are simply aligned to the MSB and the configuration iterates on all possible values of the LSB;This value is a HW constraint related to MACT LEL, other LEM logical tables can utilize the full MDB_NOF_VMV_BITS

define.name: mact_max_payload_size
define.doc: MACT payload has to be this size or smaller

define.name: shift_vmv_max_size
define.doc: NOF of EM lookup per stage.

define.name: shift_vmv_max_regs_per_table
define.doc: NOF of different shift vmv registers associated with a single EM table.

define.name: min_nof_app_id_bits
define.doc: The minimal number of bits used to represent APP ID.

define.name: max_nof_spn_sizes
define.doc: The maximal NOF of SPN sizes options for a single EM PDB.

define.name: nof_lfsr_sizes
define.doc: The NOF of LFSR sizes options for a single EM PDB.

define.name: nof_formats
define.doc: The NOF formats which the EM application can used, a format define by the key size and address size and the table address space.

define.name: defragmentation_priority_supported
define.doc: Overflow CAM defrag machine has priority over Host/Ext support.

define.name: disable_cuckoo_loop_detection_support
define.doc: indicate if the device has an option to disable loop detectionin cuckoo processing

define.name: disable_cuckoo_hit_bit_sync
define.doc: indicate if the device has an option to disable cuckoo hit bit handle

define.name: age_profile_per_ratio_support
define.doc: indicate if the device has an age profile per ratio support.

define.name: flex_mag_supported
define.doc: the flex supported in the MAG but not necessarily fully supported

define.name: flex_fully_supported
define.doc: flex feature is fully supported (if this is set so does the flex_mag_supported should be).

define.name: step_table_max_size
define.doc: The max NOF rows that a step table can hold.

define.name: nof_encoding_values
define.doc: the NOF encoding values (values that represent the payload size out of row width) in the device

define.name: nof_encoding_types
define.doc: the NOF encoding types (ONE/HALF/QUARTER/EIGHTH) in the device

define.name: extra_vmv_shift_registers
define.doc: Device have a larger NOF VMV shift registers.

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB (only EM tables are valid in this case)

value.name: nof_spn_size
value.doc: The NOF SPNs sizes available for a given EM table.

key.name: lfsr_index
key.doc: the index number of the requseted LFSR.

value.name: init_value
value.doc: When an entry is entered/learned this is the initial age value that it received.

value.name: global_value
value.doc: Allows updating the age value in multiplication of scan cycles.

value.name: global_mask
value.doc: Allows updating the age value in multiplication of scan cycles.

value.name: external_profile
value.doc: Whether to take the age configuration from this register or externally (e.g. MACT age configuration).

value.name: elephant_values
value.doc: A lower age threshold which an entry that reaches/pass this age threshold get some dedicated payload.

value.name: mouse_values
value.doc: An upper age threshold which an entry that reaches/pass this age threshold get some dedicated payload.

value.name: age_max_values
value.doc: An entry age can be update up to this value.

value.name: increment_values
value.doc: In case of an entry hit the age will be incremented by this value.

value.name: decrement_values
value.doc: In case the age scan found the an entry was not accessed (no hit) the age value will be decremented by this value.

value.name: out_values
value.doc: The age of entry that trigger entry removal (usually it will be zero).

value.name: hit_bit_mode
value.doc: The hit bit mode that will determine an age hit.

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB (only EM tables are valid in this case)

table.name: step_table_pdb_max_depth
table.doc: hold the maximal depth of the step table that is supported by an EM PDB.

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB (only EM tables are valid in this case)

table.name: step_table_max_depth_possible
table.doc: hold the maximal depth of the step table for different aspect ratio combinations and table sizes

key.name: step_table_size_indication
key.doc: indicate the step table size where 0> 512, 1->1024 and 2->2048 means rows in the step table.

key.name: aspect_ratio_combination
key.doc: the aspect ratio that are in the step table where bit to ratio mapping is 0->one, 1->half, 2->quarter, 3->eighth

table.name: mdb_em_shift_vmv_regs
table.doc: Holds the shift vmv DBAL tables associated with each MDB EM table.

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB (only EM tables are valid in this case)

value.name: nof_valid_regs
value.doc: The NOF valid shift vmv regs associated with this table.

value.name: stage_index_arr
value.doc: The index within the specific register.

define.name: physical_address_max_bits
define.doc: The number of DB_ATR_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_SPACE bits associated with encoding 0.

define.name: physical_address_max_bits_support_single_macro_b_granularity_fec_alloc
define.doc: The largest address space value which can support a single macro B granularity for the FEC

define.name: vsi_physical_address_max_bits
define.doc: The VSI number of DB_ATR_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_SPACE bits associated with encoding 0.

define.name: fec_address_mapping_bits
define.doc: The FEC address mapping bits.

define.name: fec_address_mapping_bits_relevant
define.doc: The FEC relevant mapping bits.

define.name: fec_max_cluster_pairs
define.doc: The maximal NOF cluster that can be associated to two FEC hierarchies.

define.name: max_payload_size
define.doc: The largest payload size associated with a direct table.

define.name: nof_fecs_in_super_fec
define.doc: NOF of FECs contained in a single super FEC.

define.name: nof_fec_ecmp_hierarchies
define.doc: NOF of FEC/ECMP hierarchies.

numeric.name: map_payload_size_enum
numeric.doc: Payload size Enum of PMF MAPS DB, configured using pmf_maps_payload_size SOC property

numeric.name: map_payload_type_enum
numeric.doc: Payload type Enum of PMF MAPS DB, configured using pmf_maps_payload_size SOC property

numeric.name: map_payload_size
numeric.doc: Payload size of PMF MAPS DB, configured using pmf_maps_payload_size SOC property

table.name: direct_info
table.doc: general information of the direct table PDBs

key.name: dbal_id
key.doc: logical tables according to the XML definitions from the MDB

value.name: payload_type
value.doc: the type of the direct payload

table.name: hit_bit_pos_in_abk
table.doc: Each 30 bits of each entry has a matching ABK bit, this table matches hit bit option to an ABK hit bit position.

value.name: hit_bit_position
value.doc: The hit bit position in the ABK (relative to the entry).

feature.name: eedb_bank_hitbit_masked_clear
feature.doc: If enabled, it is possible to do a masked hitbit clear on the eedb abk bank.

define.name: phase_map_bits
define.doc: number of msbits used for the phase mapping.

define.name: phase_map_array_size
define.doc: Size of phase map array.

define.name: nof_phase_per_mag
define.doc: the NOF phases each MAGs Is associated with.

define.name: nof_phases
define.doc: NOF of EEDB phases.

define.name: nof_eedb_mags
define.doc: NOF of EEDB MAGs

define.name: nof_eedb_banks
define.doc: NOF of EEDB banks

define.name: nof_phases_per_eedb_bank
define.doc: Each EEDB bank can be associated with one of this amount of phases

define.name: nof_phases_per_eedb_bank_size
define.doc: nof_phases_per_eedb_bank size

define.name: phase_bank_select_default
define.doc: the default phase value for a bank.

define.name: entry_format_bits
define.doc: Number of MSbits used to determine the payload size in MDB_ENTRY_FORMATr

define.name: entry_format_encoding_bits
define.doc: Number of bits used to represent the payload size (30/60/90/120) in MDB_ENTRY_FORMATr

define.name: bank_id_bits
define.doc: Number of bits used for bank_id comparison.

value.name: nof_available_banks
value.doc: NOF available banks for the phase.

table.name: outlif_physical_phase_granularity
table.doc: Assign an outlif physical phase granularity.

value.name: data_granularity
value.doc: The granularity of the EEDB data.

define.name: nof_small_bbs
define.doc: nof small BBs.

define.name: nof_big_bbs_blk_ids
define.doc: nof KBPSDK blk_ids associated with big BBs.

define.name: nof_rows_in_small_bb
define.doc: nof row in a small BB.

define.name: nof_rows_in_small_rpb_hitbits
define.doc: nof row in a small RPB hitbits.

define.name: nof_bytes_in_hitbit_row
define.doc: nof bytes in a hitbit database row.

define.name: key_lsn_bits
define.doc: RPB input = {key, search_lsn}.

define.name: key_prefix_length
define.doc: The KAPS DB prefix length.

define.name: max_prefix_in_bb_row
define.doc: The maximum number of prefixes in a single KAPS BB row.

define.name: key_width_in_bits
define.doc: The KAPS(LPM) key size.

define.name: ad_width_in_bits
define.doc: The KAPS(LPM) payload size.

define.name: bb_byte_width
define.doc: the BB width in bytes

define.name: rpb_byte_width
define.doc: the RPB width in bytes

define.name: ads_byte_width
define.doc: the ADS width in bytes

define.name: rpb_valid_bits
define.doc: the RPB valid size in bits

define.name: dynamic_memory_access_dpc
define.doc: The KAPS dynamic memory is of DPC type.

numeric.name: result_core0_db0_reg
numeric.doc: The LPM search interface result for core 0 db 0.

numeric.name: result_core0_db1_reg
numeric.doc: The LPM search interface result for core 0 db 1.

numeric.name: result_core1_db0_reg
numeric.doc: The LPM search interface result for core 1 db 0.

numeric.name: result_core1_db1_reg
numeric.doc: The LPM search interface result for core 1 db 1.

numeric.name: big_kaps_revision_val
numeric.doc: The big KAPS revision register value to pass on to the KBPSDK.

table.name: big_bb_blk_id_mapping
table.doc: Mapping from KBPSDK blk_id to global_macro_index

key.name: blk_id
key.doc: The KBPSDK blk_id, first big BB blk_id is 0

value.name: global_macro_index
value.doc: The global_macro_index associated with the blk_id

feature.name: step_table_supports_mix_ar_algo
feature.doc: step table fully support mix aspect ratio algorithm. HWJERICHO2-2156

feature.name: eedb_bank_traffic_lock
feature.doc: Unable to write to eedb after traffic has been sent through it. HWJERICHO2-2622

feature.name: em_dfg_ovf_cam_disabled
feature.doc: EM overflow CAM DFG is disabled. HWJERICHO2-2208

feature.name: em_mact_transplant_no_reply
feature.doc: EM MACT transplant does not generate reply. HWJERICHO2-2481

feature.name: em_mact_use_refresh_on_insert
feature.doc: EM MACT add entry should use refresh command instead of insert command. HWJERICHO2-2600

feature.name: em_mact_insert_flush_drop_on_exceed_limit
feature.doc: EM MACT insert that exceeds limit returns fail_reason == FLUSH_DROP instead of EXCEED_LIMIT. HWJERICHO2-2581

feature.name: em_sbus_interface_shutdown
feature.doc: EM interface shuts down SW interface to the ASIC until EM process ends. HWJERICHO2-2091

feature.name: em_ecc_simple_command_deadlock
feature.doc: EM simple command interface deadlocks in case it encounters an ECC error when DMA-mode is set. HWJERICHO2-2695

feature.name: em_compare_init
feature.doc: EM compare init requires HW read. HWJERICHO2-2734
